intro: Machaerina cubensis, commonly known as Cuban machaerina, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, palmate leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive red center, which bloom during the dry season. Machaerina cubensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air.
